etymology.description: 半(半) (bàn, "half") + 力(力) (lì, "strength") = exerting half one's strength -> manage or handle
etymology.interpretation: 辦(辦) (bàn, "handle") combines 半(半) (bàn, "half") for phonetic indication with 力(力) (lì, "strength") for semantic, suggesting managing or handling tasks with effort.

examples.chinese: 他辦事有條不紊(他辦事有條不紊)。
examples.english: He handles matters in an organized manner.

examples.chinese: 她辦理文件(她辦理文件)，準時完成任務(準時完成任務)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bànlǐ wénjiàn, zhǔnshí wánchéng rènwù.
examples.english: She handled the documents and completed the tasks on time.

examples.chinese: 我們辦了一個重要會議(我們辦了一個重要會議)。
